description: The post outlines an issue related to the Windows Boot Manager caused by revocations tied to Secure Boot changes associated with CVE-2023-24932. Users may encounter errors when attempting to boot their systems due to these revocations, which can prevent successful startup processes. The problem is addressed in KB-5025885, which provides guidance on managing the Windows Boot Manager settings to resolve issues arising from Secure Boot configuration changes. Failure to apply the necessary updates or registry adjustments may lead to an inability to load the operating system. Correct management of certificates and Secure Boot settings is crucial to ensuring system stability and performance following these security updates.
